svcprocinfo.para: The installation of the cab onto the chassis can be performed providing an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture are available. Installation procedures may vary for various models depending on type of equipment and accessories.

svcsubproc.title: Cab Squaring
svcsubproc.para: Cab squaring is the centering and perpendicular positioning of the cab structure to the frame. The cab must be squared whenever the cab has been removed from the chassis for repair, or if a new cab is being mounted.

The cab must be properly squared to the frame as this will affect the relationship between the cab and hood. Improper squaring may result in unacceptable appearance and interference between the cab and hood. Be sure the chassis is on a level surface before squaring.
Center cab on frame rail by measuring from inside of cab cowl to outside of frame rail on both sides, measurement should be equal on both sides, front and rear.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models

step1.para:
To install cabs with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models. Carefully lower cab down to the front and rear mounting locations, make sure that mounting studs, bolts and mounting holes are positioned properly as the cab is lowered onto the cab mounting brackets. Refer to (Figure 128) and (Figure 129) for Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models before March 2002
or refer to (Figure 130) and (Figure 129) for Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models after March 2002.

svcsubproc.title: Install Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If removed or being replaced, position the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3) in place on the frame rail crossmember (Item 8) and install per steps below.
Connect the air line connection to the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3).

Line up the four mounting holes in the bottom plate of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3) with the four mounting holes in the frame rail crossmember (Item 8). Install the four hex flanged bolts (Item 7) through the mounting holes in the rear cab air suspension assembly and the frame rail crossmember. Install four hex flanged nuts (Item 6) onto the four hex flanged bolts. Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If removed or being replaced, from inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and install the two carriage bolts (Item 2) through the cab floor and cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor.

While holding carriage bolts (Item 2) so that the square shank under the head of the carriage bolts are secured in the cab floor, thread retaining clips (Item 5) onto both carriage bolts until they are against the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 4).
Before the seats are installed, position the floor mat properly on the floor of the cab and install seat belt mounting bolts securing seat belts to cab floor at the rear of the cab.

Once the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been installed or replaced and the seat belts have been secured to the cab floor, install the driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat or fixed passenger seat on standard cab, full width rear bench seat or bunk/storage unit on extended cab or full width rear bench seat on crew cab, refer to
SEATS
. For installing driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing full width rear bench seat , refer to Install Full Width Rear Bench Seat on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If so equipped, refer to
EXTENDED CAB BUNK/STORAGE UNIT
. For installing bunk/storage unit, refer to Install Bunk/Storage Unit on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models.

svcsubproc.title: Install Mid High Front Cab Mounting Isolators for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models before March 2002
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 128 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If the front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) was removed, or being replaced. Install the front cab mounting isolator onto the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) before the cab is installed on the chassis, driver side shown.

Position front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) in place on top of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 8) through front cab mounting isolator and cab chassis mounting bracket and install two hex flanged nuts (Item 7), driver side shown. Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting isolator.

svcsubproc.title: Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models before March 2002

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab over chassis.
Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab has been lowered onto the chassis and the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been positioned properly through the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 128 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Also, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position properly the front cab mounting brackets (Item 5) onto the front cab chassis mounting brackets (Item 3).

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.
Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 2). Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 128 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install hex flanged bolt (Item 4) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) and front cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.

Position cab mount safety retainer (Item 2) under cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) and slide over hex flanged bolt (Item 4). Install hex flanged nut (Item 1), driver side shown. Tighten to 254 to 310 Lbf-ft (344 to 420 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting hardware.
Remove cab lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Cab with Mid High Front Cab Mounting and Mid High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 8500 Models after March 2002

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab over chassis.
Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly per step a and step b below.
Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the two carriage bolts (Item 2) properly through the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).
Position properly the threaded stud (Item 2, Figure 130) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3, Figure 130) through the front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, Figure 130) .

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.
Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 130 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install hex flanged nut (Item 1) onto the threaded stud (Item 2) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown. Tighten to 142 to 175 Lbf-ft (193 to 237 N•m)
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting hardware.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 129 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 2). Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Remove cab lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models

step1.para:
To install cabs with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models. Carefully lower cab down to the front and rear mounting locations, make sure that mounting studs, bolts and mounting holes are positioned properly as the cab is lowered onto the cab mounting brackets. Refer to (Figure 131) and (Figure 132) for Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models before March 2002
or refer to (Figure 133) and (Figure 132) for Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models after March 2002.

svcsubproc.title: Install High Rear Cab Air Suspension for 7600 and 8600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If removed or being replaced, position the cab air suspension assembly (Item 3) in place on the frame rail crossmember (Item 8) and install per steps below.
Connect the air line connection to the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3).

Line up the four mounting holes in the bottom plate of the rear cab air suspension assembly (Item 3) with the four mounting holes in the frame rail crossmember (Item 8). Install the four hex flanged bolts (Item 7) through the mounting holes in the rear cab air suspension assembly and the frame rail crossmember. Install four hex flanged nuts (Item 6) onto the four hex flanged bolts. Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts for 7600 and 8600 Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If removed or being replaced, from inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and install the two carriage bolts (Item 2) through the cab floor and cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor.

While holding carriage bolts (Item 2) so that the square shank under the head of the carriage bolts are secured in the cab floor, thread retaining clips (Item 5) onto both carriage bolts until they are against the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 4).
Before the seats are installed, position the floor mat properly on the floor of the cab and install seat belt mounting bolts securing seat belts to cab floor at the rear of the cab.

Once the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been installed or replaced and the seat belts have been secured to the cab floor, install the driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat or fixed passenger seat on standard cab, full width rear bench seat or bunk/storage unit on extended cab or full width rear bench seat on crew cab, refer to
SEATS
. For installing driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing full width rear bench seat , refer to Install Full Width Rear Bench Seat on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If so equipped, refer to
EXTENDED CAB BUNK/STORAGE UNIT
. For installing bunk/storage unit, refer to Install Bunk/Storage Unit on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models.

svcsubproc.title: Install High Front Cab Mounting Insulators for 7600 and 8600 Models before March 2002
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: If the front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) was removed, or being replaced. Install the front cab mounting isolator onto the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) before the cab is installed on the chassis, driver side shown.

Position front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) in place on top of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3). Install two hex flanged bolts (Item 8) through front cab mounting isolator and cab chassis mounting bracket and install two hex flanged nuts (Item 7), driver side shown. Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting isolator.

svcsubproc.title: Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models before March 2002

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab over chassis.
Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Once the cab has been lowered onto the chassis and the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been positioned properly through the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Also, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position properly the front cab mounting brackets (Item 5) onto the cab chassis mounting brackets (Item 3).

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.
Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 2). Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 131 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install hex flanged bolt (Item 4) through front cab mounting bracket (Item 5), front cab mounting isolator (Item 6) and front cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.

Position cab mount safety retainer (Item 2) under cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3) and slide over hex flanged bolt (Item 4). Install hex flanged nut (Item 1), driver side shown. Tighten to 254 to 310 Lbf-ft (344 to 420 N•m).
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting hardware.
Remove cab lifting fixture.

svcsubproc.title: Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 and 8600 Models after March 2002

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab over chassis.
Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly per step a and step b below.
Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the two carriage bolts (Item 2) properly through the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).
Position properly the threaded stud (Item 2, Figure 133) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3, Figure 133) through the front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, Figure 133) .

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 133 for Items in parentheses.

Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting hardware.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 132 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 2). Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).

svcsubproc.title: Install Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005

step1.para: To install cabs with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005. Carefully lower cab down to the front and rear mounting locations, make sure that mounting studs, bolts and mounting holes are positioned properly as the cab is lowered onto the cab mounting brackets. Refer to (Figure 133) and (Figure 134) for Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005.

svcsubproc.title: Install High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting Carriage Bolts for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 134 for Items in parentheses.

note.para: The Cab Air Suspension System shown for the 7600 and 7700 Models in (Figure 134) is built with the crossmember as part of the cab air suspension system, it is installed as a assembly at the assembly plant.

step1.para: If removed or being replaced, from inside the cab, lift the rear of the floor mat at the rear cab panel below the rear window and install the two carriage bolts (Item 2) through the cab floor and cab underbody sill (Item 4) which is part of the cab floor.

While holding carriage bolts (Item 2) so that the square shank under the head of the carriage bolts are secured in the cab floor, thread retaining clips (Item 5) onto both carriage bolts until they are against the bottom of the cab underbody sill (Item 4).
Before the seats are installed, position the floor mat properly on the floor of the cab and install seat belt mounting bolts securing seat belts to cab floor at the rear of the cab.

Once the two carriage bolts (Item 2) have been installed or replaced and the seat belts have been secured to the cab floor, install the driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat or fixed passenger seat on standard cab, full width rear bench seat or bunk/storage unit on extended cab or full width rear bench seat on crew cab, refer to
SEATS
. For installing driver bucket seat and passenger bucket seat, refer to Install Passenger Bucket Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing fixed passenger seat, refer to Install Fixed Passenger Seat on Standard Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 7700, 8500 and 8600 Models, Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. For installing full width rear bench seat , refer to Install Full Width Rear Bench Seat on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models and Crew Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500 and 7600 Models. If so equipped, refer to
EXTENDED CAB BUNK/STORAGE UNIT
. For installing bunk/storage unit, refer to Install Bunk/Storage Unit on Extended Cab for 7300, 7400, 7500, 7600, 8500 and 8600 Models.

svcsubproc.title: Cab with High Front Cab Mounting and High Rear Cab Air Suspension Mounting for 7600 Day Cab and Extended Cab Model with Rear PTO and some Engine Options and 7700 Day Cab Model after March 2005

step1.para: Using an overhead crane and cab lifting fixture, carefully lift cab over chassis.
Lower cab over chassis, as the cab is lowered onto the chassis, position front and rear cab mounting locations properly per step a and step b below.
Refer to Figure 134 for Items in parentheses.

step2.para: Position the two carriage bolts (Item 2) properly through the rear air suspension assembly (Item 3).
Position properly the threaded stud (Item 2, Figure 133) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3, Figure 133) through the front cab mounting bracket (Item 4, Figure 133) .

caution.para: Do not put all cab weight on chassis until all mounting bolts are tightened.
Inspect all cab to frame attaching points to be sure they are aligned properly or damage can result.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 133 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install hex flanged nut (Item 1) onto the threaded stud (Item 2) of the cab chassis mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown. Tighten to 142 to 175 Lbf-ft (193 to 237 N•m)
Repeat procedure to install passenger side front cab mounting hardware.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 134 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Install two hex flanged nuts (Item 1) onto the two carriage bolts (Item 2). Tighten them to 88 to 106 Lbf-ft (119 to 144 N•m).
Remove cab lifting fixture.

note.para: The remaining steps can be performed with the aid of the appropriate service sections. Refer to the Master Service Manual for the component being installed.

step1.para: Attach exhaust system if it is the vertical type.
Attach shift lever to transmission.
Connect the following items:

item.para: Air conditioning lines (if so equipped). Refer to GROUP 16 - AIR CONDITIONING BASIC THEORY, DIAGNOSIS AND SERVICE in the Master Service Manual for the proper procedures to charge air conditioning system.
Brake system (air or hydraulic). Refer to GROUP 04 - BRAKES in the Master Service Manual for bleeding instructions.

step1.para: Fill cooling system. Refer to GROUP 12 - COOLING in the Master Service Manual for the proper coolant requirements and procedures.
Connect battery ground cable.
Reattach any other connections between cab and frame, if required.
Replace or lower hood, unblock wheels, and release parking brake.
Road test vehicle. Be sure all vehicle components are operating properly before putting vehicle back into service.
